data.title: Charles de Gaulle (French President)
data.meta_description: Leader of the Free French during World War II, head of the Provisional Government of the French Republic from 1944 to 1946 and President of France from 1959...
data.text:
Charles de Gaulle

Profession: French President

Biography: Leader of the Free French during World War II, head of the Provisional Government of the French Republic from 1944 to 1946 and President of France from 1959 to 1969.

Famous for saying 'non' to Britain's entry to the European Common Market.

Born: November 22, 1890

Birthplace: Lille, France

Generation: Lost Generation

Star Sign: Sagittarius

Died: November 9, 1970 (aged 79)

Cause of Death: Ruptured blood vessel

Articles and Photos

Casablanca Conference

Henri Giraud, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Charles de Gaulle and Winston Churchill at the Casablanca Conference

Liberation of Paris

Crowds line the Champs Elysees to view the Free French forces of General Leclerc's 2nd Armored Division pass through the Arc de Triomphe

Funeral of Winston Churchill

Churchill's cortege in London during the funeral

Britain Joins the European Community

British MPs voted on this day to join the European Communities, as it was then known. It was to be a thorny issue, finally leading to ‘Brexit’ in 2020.

Historical Events

Dinant, Belgium, destroyed by German bombs. Lt Charles de Gaulle (24), injured

WWII: French counterattack at Péronne under General Charles De Gaulle

General Charles De Gaulle becomes French junior minister of Defense

General Charles de Gaulle's 1st meeting with Winston Churchill

General Charles de Gaulle makes his first speech on the BBC to the French people, since arriving in London, an appeal to defy Nazi occupiers - regarded as the beginning of French Resistance during WWII

Clermont-Ferrand sentences General Charles de Gaulle to death in absentia

French General Charles De Gaulle arrives in Algiers

British Prime Minister Winston Churchill and French General Charles de Gaulle begin a two-day wartime conference in Marrakesh

French General Charles de Gaulle forms new regime in exile, with communists

French General Charles de Gaulle arrives in London

French General Charles de Gaulle returns to France, landing in Normandy, proclaiming Bayeux the capital of Free France

French General Charles de Gaulle arrives in Washington, D.C.

US government recognizes authority of French General Charles de Gaulle

French General Charles de Gaulle returns to France

German commander Dietrich von Choltitz surrenders Paris to the Free French forces of Philippe Leclerc, disobeying Adolf Hitler's orders to destroy the city. President of the Provisional Government of the French Republic Charles de Gaulle gives a famous speech at the Hôtel de Ville.

French General Leclerc's 2nd Armored Division and Charles de Gaulle parade down the Champs Elysees in Paris after the liberation of the city from Nazi occupation

French General Charles De Gaulle arrives in Moscow, USSR

Charles De Gaulle wins French parliamentary election

French government of Prime Minister Pierre Pflimlin resigns; 200,000 demonstrate against Charles de Gaulle

Charles de Gaulle elected premier of France

French Prime Minister Charles de Gaulle arrives in Algiers

French Prime Minister Charles de Gaulle says Algeria will always be French

Charles De Gaulle wins 7 year term as 1st President of the 5th Republic of France

Charles de Gaulle inaugurated as president of France's 5th Republic

French President Charles De Gaulle grants amnesty to 130 Algerians sentenced to death

Charles de Gaulle forms French government

French President Charles de Gaulle recognizes Algerian right of self determination

US President John F. Kennedy visits Charles de Gaulle in Paris

French President Charles de Gaulle calls for Algeria's independence

Failed assassination attempt on French President Charles de Gaulle

French President Charles de Gaulle visits German FR

Elysée treaty of cooperation between France and Germany signed by Charles de Gaulle and Konrad Adenauer

Charles de Gaulle says 'Vive le Quebec libre! Long live free Quebec!'

French President Charles de Gaulle visits Poland

French President Charles de Gaulle said 'Non!' to British entry to the European Common Market for the second time

1,000,000 French demonstrate against Charles De Gaulle & Georges Pompidou

French President Charles De Gaulle proposes referendum & students set fire to Paris bourse

Charles de Gaulle resigns as president of France

Personal Life

French army captain, and future president, Charles de Gaulle (30) weds Yvonne Vendroux (20) in the Notre-Dame de Calais church

Quotes by Charles de Gaulle

"How can you govern a country which has two hundred and forty-six varieties of cheese?"

Famous French Presidents

Emmanuel Macron

François Hollande

François Mitterrand

Georges Pompidou

Napoleon III

Nicolas Sarkozy
